newsitem.title: GERMANY: Gehe silent on bid plans, shares steady.
newsitem.headline: Gehe silent on bid plans, shares steady.

text.p: German pharmaceuctical wholesaler Gehe AG on Monday kept silent on its possible plans to launch a new bid for U.K. group Lloyds Chemists Plc, a move that initially pushed shares down over two percent in early trade.
By 1008 GMT however Gehe shares had recovered all losses to trade up one mark at 109 after testing a session low of 106 marks. The broader market was down 0.30 percent at 2,726.54 points.

Gehe, locked in a bitter 10-month takeover battle with U.K. group UniChem, on Monday again refused to comment on its specific future plans after saying it was still generally interested in taking over the British pharmacy chain.

"We will inform the public when a decision is reached," a Gehe official said in answer to a Reuter enquiry on when another bid might be announced. The company had almost three weeks to consider its next step, it said.

All along Gehe executives have hinted that a future bid for Lloyds Chemists would have to be lower after British monopoly authorities demanded that a number of Lloyds units be sold off before a merger.
But now analysts speculate that Gehe has little room to submit a much lower bid as such a move would risk it being beaten to the prize by rival UniChem's new 638.8 million sterling bid.
Gehe earlier this year submitted a 650 million sterling cash offer for the group.
